summary: The 'Mapping America's Pharmaceutical Supply Act' (MAPS Act) aims to improve the coordination of federal efforts to secure the pharmaceutical supply chain. It mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services (HHS) to: maintain a list of essential medicines; conduct risk assessments of their supply chains, identifying vulnerabilities related to foreign reliance, single suppliers, and potential shortages; and map the supply chains of essential medicines using data analytics. The bill also requires regular reporting to Congress and emphasizes cybersecurity measures.
